content.description:
Per the Miramontes guidebook: Jump to the big, sloping ramp/dish and mantel into it.

(Tall people might be able to start without jumping.)
content.location: On one of the Ayatollah Boulders, to the left if facing the arete for Shoveling Monzonite.

content.description:
Located on the west face of the boulder, just left of center and identifiable as face leading into a shallow right-facing corner; there is a large rock and a bush near the base of the problem as well.

The crux moves on this are low as you work off a sharp crimp onto a small edge for your foot, but a bit higher, at the start of the corner, is the mental crux as you must commit to a high foothold to reach the temptingly close jugs in the corner. Easy moves lead up the corner to the top and there's an easy descent to the right.

Fun moves on good rock but you really don't want to fall off this once you're past the crux.

Named for it's slight resemblance to

The Ayatollah

(5.11b/c) at nearby Cap Rock.

This is the easiest way up the boulder and climbs the featured right arete. Also useful as a downclimb if not inclined to jumping off.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the west face.

climbs.name: The Ayatollah of Rock and Rolla

content.description:
Located in the center of the west face of the boulder, just right of

False Ayatollah

(V0 R) and directly behind a large creosote bush.

Step off a rock onto the boulder and climb positive edges on good brown rock to a large hold midway and then stem out right to another large hold before finishing up rounded edges in a tan patch of rock at the top. There's an easy descent down and to the right.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
